nz.co.jedsimson.lgp.core.environment.config

Class Configuration

  • nz.co.jedsimson.lgp.core.environment.config.Configuration

  • public class Configuration

    Represents the parameters that can be set for the an LGP environment.

    An implementation of interface ConfigurationLoader can load class Configurations from a specified source.

    See Also:
    interface ConfigurationLoader, class Configuration

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Configuration()
      Represents the parameters that can be set for the an LGP environment.

      • getOperations

        @NotNull
public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getOperations()

        A collection of fully-qualified class names specifying the classes of lgp.core.program.instructions.Operations to be loaded into an lgp.core.environment.Environment.

        NOTE: Custom loaders can be provided that can provided a collection of lgp.core.program.instructions.Operations in some custom way, by implementing the lgp.core.environment.operations.OperationLoader interface.

        See Also:
        lgp.core.program.instructions.Operation, lgp.core.environment.Environment, lgp.core.program.instructions.Operation, lgp.core.environment.operations.OperationLoader

      • setOperations

        public void setOperations(@NotNull
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> p)

        A collection of fully-qualified class names specifying the classes of lgp.core.program.instructions.Operations to be loaded into an lgp.core.environment.Environment.

        NOTE: Custom loaders can be provided that can provided a collection of lgp.core.program.instructions.Operations in some custom way, by implementing the lgp.core.environment.operations.OperationLoader interface.

        See Also:
        lgp.core.program.instructions.Operation, lgp.core.environment.Environment, lgp.core.program.instructions.Operation, lgp.core.environment.operations.OperationLoader

      • getConstantsRate

        public double getConstantsRate()

        The probability with which instructions in an LGP program will contain a constant value.

      • setConstantsRate

        public void setConstantsRate(double p)

        The probability with which instructions in an LGP program will contain a constant value.

      • getConstants

        @NotNull
public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getConstants()

        Any values to be used as constants in an LGP program.

        NOTE: Constants are specified as string values to permit the use of custom register types. This means that a custom lgp.core.environment.constants.ConstantLoader will need to be implemented to load the list of strings into an appropriate type suitable to be loaded into a register set.

        See Also:
        lgp.core.environment.constants.ConstantLoader

      • setConstants

        public void setConstants(@NotNull
                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> p)

        Any values to be used as constants in an LGP program.

        NOTE: Constants are specified as string values to permit the use of custom register types. This means that a custom lgp.core.environment.constants.ConstantLoader will need to be implemented to load the list of strings into an appropriate type suitable to be loaded into a register set.

        See Also:
        lgp.core.environment.constants.ConstantLoader

      • getStoppingCriterion

        public double getStoppingCriterion()

        Determines the threshold for stopping the evolutionary process.

        When a solution with a fitness of stoppingCriterion is found, the search will stop. By default, we don't stop until the fitness is minimised perfectly.

        See Also:
        stoppingCriterion

      • setStoppingCriterion

        public void setStoppingCriterion(double p)

        Determines the threshold for stopping the evolutionary process.

        When a solution with a fitness of stoppingCriterion is found, the search will stop. By default, we don't stop until the fitness is minimised perfectly.

        See Also:
        stoppingCriterion

      • getNumberOfRuns

        public int getNumberOfRuns()

        Provides the ability to pass in the number of runs as a configuration parameter instead of a hard-coded value in the problem definition.

        The parameter is not used by default anywhere in the system, but consumers can choose to use it.

      • setNumberOfRuns

        public void setNumberOfRuns(int p)

        Provides the ability to pass in the number of runs as a configuration parameter instead of a hard-coded value in the problem definition.

        The parameter is not used by default anywhere in the system, but consumers can choose to use it.
